Availability of general education courses outside of the owning Faculty may be restricted by the Program Authority, usually because they are closely related to the study area of the student’s program."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[{"dependent_type":{"label":null,"value":null},"ai_cl_id":{"value":"GENY0001","cl_id":"dc5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191a","key":"code"},"association_type":{"label":"Equivalents","value":"9"},"association_desc":"","associated_ai_cl_id":{"value":"GENY0003","cl_id":"8e5489efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961931","key":"code"},"cl_id":"dc5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961922","assoc_credit_points":"6","assoc_active":"true","assoc_title":"Academic Skills Plus","assoc_cl_id":"8e5489efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961931","assoc_short_title":"GENY0003 - Academic Skills Plus","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2022/GENY0003","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"show","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"GENY0003","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"DVC (Academic) Board of Studies","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"GENY0001 - Academic Skills Plus","description":"

Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Comedy through the ages'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two hour academic skills seminar.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191c","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay 1","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"15","description":"

Essay 1 builds a foundation for the subsequent Essay 2. It takes the form of an essay: Introduction, Body paragraphs, Conclusion. The focus is more on structure, then content. The essay question will be included in the Course Outline. 


A criteria feedback sheet will be attached to each assignment. There will also be extensive written feedback on the text of the assignment. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"6c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396192b","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"15","description":"

Students in groups will prepare and give a spoken presentation and lead a short discussion in the class on one of the Readings (10 mins). This will include: Introduction, Summary, Critique and final conclusions. 


Students will receive initial feedback immediately after the presentation. A criteria feedback sheet with mark will be distributed at the end of semester. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ac5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961934","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"25","description":"

The exam will test a broad range of academic skills, including referencing, paraphrasing and summarising, short answer questions, notetaking and, planning and writing a short essay. 


Students will be able to receive written feedback on their exams scripts. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"b45449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396195f","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Class participation","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"15","description":"

Class participation allows student to work on their interpersonal and collaborative skills. It also focuses on developing good skills at communicating in both informal and formal settings. It includes: willingness to ask questions, put forward ideas, report back from group work and engage co-operatively in debates in both small and large groups.


A criteria feedback sheet will be handed to students half way through the semester so that they can assess their own participation. At the end of semester the criteria feedback sheet will be distributed with a mark. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"d85449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961923","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

Essay 2 develops the ideas contained in Essay 2. It takes the form of an essay: Introduction, Body paragraphs, Conclusion. The focus is equally on structure, as well as content, and how much students have incorporated feedback from Essay 1. The essay question will be included in the Course Outline. 


A criteria feedback sheet will be attached to each assignment. There will also be extensive written feedback on the text of the assignment. 

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191d","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"945449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396191f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961920","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"9c5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f3961921","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"f85449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396193d","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2022/GENY0001.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}
contentlets.keywords: the learning centre ge,academic skills,communication skills
contentlets.description: Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Comedy through the ages'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two hour academic skills seminar.
contentlets.title: Academic Skills Plus

Availability of general education courses outside of the owning Faculty may be restricted by the Program Authority, usually because they are closely related to the study area of the student’s program."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"GENY0002 - Academic Skills Plus","description":"

Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Science fiction'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two-hour academic skills seminar.


","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199d","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay 1","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"15","description":"Essay 1 builds a foundation for the subsequent Essay 2. It takes the form of an essay: Introduction, Body paragraphs, Conclusion. The focus is more on structure, then content. The essay question will be included in the Course Outline.
A criteria feedback sheet will be attached to each assignment. There will also be extensive written feedback on the text of the assignment.","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"195449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a4","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Exam","assessment_type":{"label":"Examination","value":"examination"},"assessment_id":"4","weighting":"25","description":"The exam will test a broad range of academic skills, including referencing, paraphrasing and summarising, short answer questions, notetaking and, planning and writing a short essay.
Students will be able to receive written feedback on their exams scripts.","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"1d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619ad","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Group presentation","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"5","weighting":"15","description":"Students in groups will prepare and give a spoken presentation and lead a short discussion in the class on one of the Readings (10 mins). This will include: Introduction, Summary, Critique and final conclusions.
Students will receive initial feedback immediately after the presentation. A criteria feedback sheet with mark will be distributed at the end of semester.","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"215449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619d4","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Essay 2","assessment_type":{"label":"Essay","value":"essay"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"30","description":"Essay 2 develops the ideas contained in Essay 2. It takes the form of an essay: Introduction, Body paragraphs, Conclusion. The focus is equally on structure, as well as content, and how much students have incorporated feedback from Essay 1. The essay question will be included in the Course Outline.
A criteria feedback sheet will be attached to each assignment. There will also be extensive written feedback on the text of the assignment.","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO8","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199f","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO10","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619b2","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Class participation","assessment_type":{"label":"Performance","value":"performance"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"15","description":"Class participation allows student to work on their interpersonal and collaborative skills. It also focuses on developing good skills at communicating in both informal and formal settings. It includes: willingness to ask questions, put forward ideas, report back from small group work, work co-operatively in small groups.
A criteria feedback sheet will be handed to students half way through the semester so that they can assess their own participation. At the end of semester the criteria feedback sheet will be distributed with a mark.","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO7","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a0","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"555449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO6","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f396199e","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO9","cl_id":"5d5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619a1","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ed5449efdb25bc50be4672f5f39619db","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2022/GENY0002.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}
contentlets.keywords: the learning centre ge,academic skills,communication skills
contentlets.description: Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Science fiction'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two-hour academic skills seminar.
contentlets.title: Academic Skills Plus

Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Alice in Wonderland'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two-hour academic skills seminar.

contentlets.keywords: the learning centre ge,academic skills,communication skills
contentlets.description: Academic Skills Plus will teach you the academic skills you need to succeed in your university studies. These include how to get more out of your readings in less time, the assignment producing process, constructing introductions, paragraphs and conclusions, integrating sources, critical thinking, academic expression and presenting. You'll have the opportunity to practice these skills both in class and in your assignments. Your assignments will relate to the course's entertaining theme: 'Alice in Wonderland'. Each week there will be a one-hour lecture on the theme and a two-hour academic skills seminar.
contentlets.title: Academic Skills Plus
